questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : CORPORATE FINANCE (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is incorrect?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.option_text: Debt creditors are paid off first, and then, the equity owners are paid off.
Debt creditor bears less risk in comparison to equity owner.
Debt creditors share the profit earned by the concerned project.
Debt financing does not provide ownership rights.

questions.question_text_1: At the optimal consumption point
question_texts: At the optimal consumption point

options.option_text: The slope of the budget line is more than the marginal rate of substitution.
The consumer does not consume his whole income.
The budget line is tangent to the indifference curve.
The marginal utility of the goods is the same.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is correct?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.option_text: The feasible set is a subset of the minimum variance set.
The global minimum variance portfolio is the optimal portfolio for theinvestor.
The efficient frontier is a subset of the minimum variance set.
Investors with varying degree of risk-aversion haver different optimal riskyportfolio.

questions.question_text_1: What would be the fair price of a bet that pays 100 with a 20% probability, pays 80 with a 40% probability and pays 60 with a 40% probability?
question_texts: What would be the fair price of a bet that pays 100 with a 20% probability, pays 80 with a 40% probability and pays 60 with a 40% probability?

questions.question_text_1: Suppose a 1-year government bond is offering an 8% rate of return. Sumit has Rs 20,000, which he can invest in government bonds or lend to his friend Ramesh. He believes that Ramesh will pay back the promised amount with a 75% probability and will pay back nothing with a 25% probability. Assume that Sumit is risk neutral. What is the default premium that Sumit should ask from Ramesh?
question_texts: Suppose a 1-year government bond is offering an 8% rate of return. Sumit has Rs 20,000, which he can invest in government bonds or lend to his friend Ramesh. He believes that Ramesh will pay back the promised amount with a 75% probability and will pay back nothing with a 25% probability. Assume that Sumit is risk neutral. What is the default premium that Sumit should ask from Ramesh?

questions.question_text_1: Axis Bank has assets of 1500 units, liabilities of 750 units and capital of 750 units. What is the leverage ratio for Axis Bank?
question_texts: Axis Bank has assets of 1500 units, liabilities of 750 units and capital of 750 units. What is the leverage ratio for Axis Bank?

questions.question_text_1: There are two assets: a risk-free asset that offers a 6% rate of return and a risky asset that has an expected rate of return of 24% and a standard deviation of 9%. What is the slope of the budget line of a portfolio consisting of these two assets (Note: standard deviation of portfolio return is on horizontal axis and expected return of portfolio is on vertical axis)?
question_texts: There are two assets: a risk-free asset that offers a 6% rate of return and a risky asset that has an expected rate of return of 24% and a standard deviation of 9%. What is the slope of the budget line of a portfolio consisting of these two assets (Note: standard deviation of portfolio return is on horizontal axis and expected return of portfolio is on vertical axis)?

questions.question_text_1: Asset A has a correlation of 0.4 with the market and a standard deviation of 16%. If the market return has a standard deviation of 4%, what is the beta of asset A?
question_texts: Asset A has a correlation of 0.4 with the market and a standard deviation of 16%. If the market return has a standard deviation of 4%, what is the beta of asset A?

questions.question_text_1: You create a portfolio of 9 identical assets that have an expected return of 22% and a standard deviation of 12%. These 9 assets are uncorrelated with each other. What is the standard deviation of your portfolio?
question_texts: You create a portfolio of 9 identical assets that have an expected return of 22% and a standard deviation of 12%. These 9 assets are uncorrelated with each other. What is the standard deviation of your portfolio?

questions.question_text_1: A grocery store can be worth 100 thousand in two years with a 35% probability or 200 thousand in two years with a 65% probability, depending on local consumer demand. The appropriate cost of capital is 12% per year. What is the present value of the outlet? (up to two decimal points)
question_texts: A grocery store can be worth 100 thousand in two years with a 35% probability or 200 thousand in two years with a 65% probability, depending on local consumer demand. The appropriate cost of capital is 12% per year. What is the present value of the outlet? (up to two decimal points)

questions.question_text_1: Suppose Rakesh decides to short sell 50 shares of Wipro Inc. The current share price for Wipro Inc is Rs 200. At the end of 1 year, share price for Wipro Inc drops to Rs 190. How much profit does Rakesh makes by exercising shorting on Wipro Inc shares?
question_texts: Suppose Rakesh decides to short sell 50 shares of Wipro Inc. The current share price for Wipro Inc is Rs 200. At the end of 1 year, share price for Wipro Inc drops to Rs 190. How much profit does Rakesh makes by exercising shorting on Wipro Inc shares?

questions.question_text_1:
You purchase a farm located near a river for 500 thousand units. You believe that there is a 4% chance of flooding in the river in the next year. If there is a flood, the produce in the farm gets destroyed, and the total payoff is 240 thousand units in the next year; otherwise, the farm generates a payoff of 600 thousand units in the next year. The appropriate cost of capital is 20% per year. Suppose you finance your purchase with a loan of 400 thousand units and the remaining amount as equity. 
Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts:
You purchase a farm located near a river for 500 thousand units. You believe that there is a 4% chance of flooding in the river in the next year. If there is a flood, the produce in the farm gets destroyed, and the total payoff is 240 thousand units in the next year; otherwise, the farm generates a payoff of 600 thousand units in the next year. The appropriate cost of capital is 20% per year. Suppose you finance your purchase with a loan of 400 thousand units and the remaining amount as equity. 
Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: What would be the appropriate promised rate of return that the creditor of the loan would demand?
question_texts: What would be the appropriate promised rate of return that the creditor of the loan would demand?

questions.question_text_1: If Nikita pays p for an insurance policy that would pay her 600 units if she suffered a severe injury, then she would be sure to have an income of 800-p regardless of whether she is injured. What would be the largest price that Nikita would be willing to pay for such insurance?
question_texts: If Nikita pays p for an insurance policy that would pay her 600 units if she suffered a severe injury, then she would be sure to have an income of 800-p regardless of whether she is injured. What would be the largest price that Nikita would be willing to pay for such insurance?
